name: Zack Zero
description: Zack Zero takes you on an action-packed platform adventure with incredible 3D graphics and the playability and entertainment of classic 2D games. Help Zack Zero save his beloved Marlene, kidnapped by the evil Zulrog in an effort to obtain the powerful substance that will allow him to travel back in time.

reviews.review_text: A beautiful game and great story, however the controls have a bit of laggy response at time when things get really active on screen. Also clipping issues. The holy hell of all clipping issues that games has.

If you are up for a fun game without a lot of keys to remember, this may be a game for you, if you have a child that you want to monitor with the kinds of games there playing I can also see this being a game you would want to look in to the action is fast, graphics are not bad and you don’t need a high end system to play it, I my self-played it on a pc with cup that is a a6 3670 2.7GH 22GB of Ram and a AMD r9 card. From 1 to 10 Ill give this game a 8.5. This game is not crisis, call of duty or a aliens game so don’t compare it to such

It's all very good fun! Nice bright graphics, well thought out and executed game. The only problem with it is that you really do need a controller to play it, becuase the implementation for the PC keyboard is absolutely terrible. It's doesn't really make any logical sense and changing the layout is very tedious indeed. It really does give the impression that hardly no effort went in to converting this for PC use. Shame, becuase as it is I can't recommend it unless you own a controller.

Zack Zero is your average side scrolling action game with some platforming elements. It isn't bad by any means, it just doesn't do anything to stand out. It has good level design, some interesting platforming, and a bit of variety in combat. You upgrade your suit as you go along to make you more powerful, and unlock different abilities for the four suit types (normal, rock, fire, and ice). This gives the game a bit of a MegaMan feel to it.  Graphics and sound are good. The game runs fine on my PC with no issues. On a side note, I have read others having issues with controls, I have not. I do however use a 360 controller so I don't know what difference that may make.   All in all, if you enjoy side scrolling action games with platforming elements and a sprinkle of mega man weapon variety thrown in, pick this up.
I won this game in the Christmas Gem-raffle, farmed the cards, sold them for profit.  10/10 would do again.
Why the hate? is a decent plataformer!
You play as an annoying white teenager, with most of the powers of the Fantastic 4. Competent platformer for ages 8-12, with high production values and overwrought generic good vs evil story.

Metacritics are sometimes too hard on some games. If this one deserves a mere 50%, so no 2D Mario title could ever hit better than 25 or 30%. Yes it's an old school platformer and of course it doesn't have the graph of a new gen title but heh, it's 10 bucks not 50. You want a good old fashioned plateformer with a Ratchet & Clankesque childish look? So don't hesitate any longer.

This is a cool game, especially for kids. It's simple and enjoyable. No death penalties. Die as often as you like. You'll respawn at the nearest checkpoint and there are plenty of checkpoints. You have 4 different powers. Fire, Ice, Earth Powers and your normal attacks. You'll gain stronger powers every few levels. The story is a bit weak but it's alright.  But here is the big problem which turns the review into a negative one: It's unplayabale due to crashes. A few people experienced crashes at the first level and could solve it with turning off steam ingame overlay and steam cloud for this game. Some needed to tweak the .CFG file. In my case nothing worked so far. I'm half through the game and it crashes every time at the same spot.    TL;DR

This game shows flashes of awesome, but those brief positive bits are brought down by bad controls, poor level design, and a lack of polish. The four different suit types and their different mechanics are very interesting, similar to something like Trine where the level puzzles are built around different abilities at different moments. The controls are sluggish and sometimes inconsistent. I caught my character grabbing the ledge in one case, and completely missing it when running into it in another. The enemies can move in 3D space, but you're stuck on a 2D space. That makes for some really confusing combat moments where you think you hit an enemy, but you actually didn't and take damage from them instead. Overall, it just feels like a game that could have benefitted by a good bit of polish and different design perspectives.

I got this in a bundle. Feels buggy, laggy, and rushed. There are a lot of better platformers to choose from. This doesn't stand out aside from the nearly interesting character design, though even that doesn't quite all mesh together well.

Paid 99 cents for it and feel it was 98 cents too expensive. Awful level design where some platforms are platforms and others just part of the background. Lots of cheap deaths from falling down holes that don't look like holes. It has a very hard time being stable, crashes every twenty minutes. ♥♥♥♥ poor hit detection. Controls that don't always trigger. It's an interesting concept, art style and everything...it just wasn't executed properly. Feels like a bad PS1/N64 title with higher resolution.
A generic/outdated plataformer.  Reminds me of a child's cartoon. The narration/storytelling is quite weak. The controls are quite unpolished.
